author: Joshua Robinson
title: The Fall of the House of Leicester - WSJ
text:
In Depth The Fall of the House of Leicester How the inspirational English soccer team that defied 5,000-1 odds crashed back to Earth so quickly By @JoshRobinson23 Feb. 21, 2017 3:27 p.m. ET 
On a frigid Monday in January, Leicester City manager Claudio Ranieri escaped the British Midlands for an evening and touched down in Switzerland, tuxedo in hand. The man who had orchestrated one of the great sporting miracles—Leicester City’s 5,000-to-one run to last season’s Premier League title—had been getting a lot of black-tie invitations recently. 
This one came straight from FIFA. Ranieri, a bespectacled 65-year-old, was being honored at a gala as world soccer’s manager of the year. But something felt off. As he... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Most Popular Videos
